# Slime People
Slime people are sentient blobs of non-newtonian fluid and organs who breathe nitrogen.
## Slime Lungs
Slime people breathe nitrogen instead of oxygen, which is abundant in the station air, but harder to find compressed into gas tanks. They exhale nitrous oxide and are unaffected by it. Slime people asphyxiate 80% slower than humans.
## Slime Metabolism
Slime people can metabolize six reagents at once, instead of the usual two.
## Slime Storage
Slime people have an [bold]internal 2x3 storage inventory[/bold] inside of their slime membrane. Anyone can see what's inside and take it out of you without asking, so be careful.
## Slime Healing
Slime people have a very slight accelerated regeneration compared to other humanoids.
## Non-Newtonian Body
Slimes take 40% reduced [color=#ec3a3a]Blunt[/color] damage and 20% reduced [color=#ec3a3a]Poison[/color], as well as 80% reduced [color=#ec3a3a]Cellular[/color]. Slime people also take pressure damage 9% faster than other species.
## Drawbacks
Slime blood cannot be regenerated from iron. Additionally, slime blood is a source of debatably nutritious food for other species. Slimes take 50% more [color=#ec3a3a]Cold[/color] damage, 20% more [color=#ec3a3a]Piercing[/color] damage, and 20% more [color=#ec3a3a]Slashing[/color] damage.
